subSubSection.paragraph:
Indocryphalus Eggers, 1939b: 6
( Figs. 22 A, B, E, F )
Antennal club without indication of sutures. Mycangia on hypomeron either vertical (dorso-ventrally elongate) or horizontal (antero-posteriorly elongate).
As described for tribe. Antennal club without an indication of a suture. Mycangia on hypomeron either vertical (dorso-ventrally elongate) or horizontal (antero-posteriorly elongate).
Similar to female except lacking mycangia, and pronotal declivity less steep. Aedeagus as described for tribe, tegmen without apodemes.

Ten species known.
Erioschidias sericeus Schedl, 1942d
is transferred based on the divided eyes.

Syntype of
Xyloterus intermedius Sampson, 1913
( BMNH )
;
holotype
Ptilopodius kalshoveni Schedl, 1954a
( NHMW )
;
holotype and allotype of
Indocryphalus machili Wood, 1988
( USNM )
;
syntype of
Trypodendron pubipennis Blandford, 1894b
( BMNH )
;
holotype of
Trypodendron sordidum Blandford, 1894a
( BMNH )
;
holotype of
Trypodendron tropicum Browne, 1950
( BMNH )
.

.
